comment: Good professor. Clear instructions. Detail explanation and go over many examples. Lots of homework and problem practicing. Fair grader. Pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: He will make you work for every point. If you read the textbook and spend time teaching yourself, you should be fine. I wanted a lot of You Tube videos to supplement the book. Start any of his assignments EARLY and be sure to schedule time with him well in advance to go over your work if you want to have any chance at getting above a 'B' from him.

You have to work for an A.  Class attendance is not required, if you want to do well I would recommend you go.  Read the chapter before class and do the practice quizzes it will definitely help.  You definitely have to put in the work for that A.

Clear about what he expected and yes read the chapter before class. Practice Quizzes prepare you for the online quizzes TAKE THEM, don't be dumb. I passed the class with a 96. Tests are similar to the practice quizzes. Work hard and he will help. Practice a lot and go to class. He likes to talk about himself but he knows what he is talking about!
Professor Devaney cares as much as you do. Don't show up for class or work hard? He's not going to help you. If he knows you, and you show up to class he'll move mountains to help you.

Professor Devaney will put forth as much effort as you will to see you pass. I did well in the class, but I also intend to become an accountant. He will help you if you show up to class and he knows your face. Otherwise, don't ask him for the time of day. He's a nice guy, but just isn't going to waste time on people who aren't interested.

One of the most difficult 'B's I've ever earned. That being said, it is also because he gives so many opportunities to pull up your grades with various assignments. If it were not for that, I would have failed. Very tough class but just as fair. He's got a friendly personality and great teaching skills. Go to class and put in the work!!

Don't take if you want an easy A. He is organized, and his grading system is crystal clear. He knows his material and is willing to help people who help themselves.  His motto "under promise and over deliver" if you need help ask him, he takes time for everyone's questions. I will def be taking him in future accounting classes.

Professor Devaney was a great professor. His class requires you to actually put in effort. You must read the textbook, complete the online quizzes, and actually study. His tests are COMPLETELY fair (he provides a helpful study guide including the topic of every question), yet they are challenging enough to make you learn. Overall a great professor.

Professor was not tough but he definitely expected you to read the chapter before coming to class.  His final is cumulative but he gets the majority of his questions from the quizzes and practice quizzes.  This class is meant to establish a very strong foundation for ACCT 2200. It will definitely prepare you for ACCT 2200!
Great professor, very helpful,available to help even on weekends, read the chapter before class, take all quizzes and assignments as he advice, he gives study guides for test. Take his classes

He was one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He doesn't know how to teach well and he is wrong about many of his calculations. He is difficult to get along with, never responds to emails, and is rarely available for extra help. I learned nothing from his class and I would never suggest taking this class unless you're an accounting genius.

I really liked Mr. Devaney. Don't take him if you want an easy A class, but if you truly want to learn accounting, take him! Tips: Read the book before class or you won't know what he's talking about. He did study sessions for his tests over in KSU center which were very helpful. I encourage going to them. Talk to him if you are struggling.
He is a really sweet guy, he expects you to put in the work for his class, and is willing to help if you help yourself. Get the book, it will help.

I just got my grade back! I got a B and there is no way I could've done that without prayer, but if you go to him and ask for help in the beginning it will be so beneficial to you! Just tell him you're struggling and he'll help you get an A! And do all of the extra credit!

Professor Devaney wants his students to learn, but he know too much of what he was talking about. I don't think he could dumb down what he was trying to say enough for students. He's from New York so ha has an accent, but it's cute..Take him if the best isn't available. He's probably next in line

Absolutley wonderful professor. He cares about his students, and if you put forth a small amount of effort he will match you three times as much. Absolutely must take for ACC 2100, its a hard course in general and he makes it so much more bearable.

I struggled with the class material a lot. Accounting is definitely not for me. That being said, Mr. Devaney wants his students to succeed and its obvious with the way he weights the grades. You can use your book for the harder assignments (done online) and then the tests are way easier and more general. He's also really friendly and funny :)

Good professor, cares about students and willing to help but not the most clear teacher. You MUST read each chapter before he lectures on it or you'll be lost. 2 tests 1 final. 1 HW and quiz due each week. Easy if you read the book and pay attention in class. Attendance isn't mandatory but you should definitely go to understand the material better.

Hybrid class. he gives weekly quizzes and homework assignments to be completed online. He can be confusing and forgetful of material. The tests are hard. If you already have a history with accounting, go for it. If not, id suggest a different teacher.
